name: Lemon Herb Chicken Thighs, Roasted Broccoli & Zucchini, Chickpea Pasta
ingredients: 4 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for chicken, 2 tbsp for veggies)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
In a bowl, toss chicken thighs with 2 tbsp olive oil, dried oregano, garlic powder, lemon zest, salt, and pepper.
Arrange chicken on one side of a large baking sheet. Roast for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through.
While chicken cooks, toss broccoli florets and sliced zucchini with the remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on the other side of the baking sheet with the chicken (or use a separate sheet). Add them to the oven when the chicken has about 18-20 minutes remaining.
Cook chickpea pasta according to package directions. Drain well.
In the pasta pot or a small bowl, toss the drained pasta with 1 tbsp olive oil (can use some reserved from the sauce oil) and the 2 minced garlic cloves.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Once chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes.
Serve the chicken alongside the roasted vegetables and chickpea pasta. Drizzle the sauce over the chicken just before serving.

name: Ground Turkey Stir-Fry, Roasted Cabbage, Carrots, Peppers, Brown Rice
ingredients: 6 carrots, peeled & cut into rounds or sticks
3 tbsp avocado oil (divided: 2 tbsp for veggies, 1 tbsp for turkey)
For Sauce: 1/4 cup tamari or soy sauce
For Sauce: 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar
For Sauce: 1 tbsp honey or maple syrup
For Sauce: 1 tsp grated fresh ginger
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss the sliced cabbage, carrots, and bell peppers with 2 tbsp avocado oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast vegetables for about 20-25 minutes, tossing halfway, until tender-crisp and slightly browned.
While vegetables roast, cook brown rice according to package directions.
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp avocado oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add the ground turkey and cook, breaking it apart with a spoon, until browned. Drain any excess fat if necessary.
Add the 3 minced garlic cloves and 1 tsp grated ginger to the turkey. Cook for 1 minute more until fragrant.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together tamari, apple cider vinegar, honey, 2 minced garlic cloves, and 1 tsp grated ginger.
Pour the sauce over the cooked turkey mixture in the skillet.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 2 minutes, stirring, until the sauce slightly thickens and coats the turkey.
Serve the turkey stir-fry mixture over cooked brown rice with the roasted vegetables on the side.

name: Maple-Dijon Salmon, Roasted Brussels Sprouts & Squash, Quinoa
ingredients: 4 salmon fillets (approx. 6 oz each), skin on or off
1.5 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
1 medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed (about 3-4 cups)
3 cups water or vegetable broth (for quinoa)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss the halved Brussels sprouts and cubed butternut squash with 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast the vegetables for 20 minutes.

While vegetables roast, cook the quinoa: Combine rinsed quinoa and water/broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed and quinoa is fluffy.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, mix together maple syrup, Dijon mustard, and minced garlic.
After the vegetables have roasted for 20 minutes, remove the baking sheet from the oven. Push the vegetables to the sides to make space for the salmon.
Place the salmon fillets (skin-side down if applicable) on the center of the baking sheet.
Brush the maple-Dijon sauce evenly over the top of each salmon fillet.
Return the baking sheet to the oven and bake for another 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily, and the vegetables are tender.
Fluff the cooked quinoa with a fork.
Serve the maple-Dijon salmon with the roasted Brussels sprouts, butternut squash, and quinoa.

name: Pork Tenderloin, Roasted Cabbage Steaks, Carrots, Lentils
ingredients: 1/2 medium head green cabbage, cut horizontally into 1-inch thick steaks
6 medium carrots, peeled and halved lengthwise (or cut into sticks)
1.5 cups brown or green lentils, rinsed
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
For Sauce: 3/4 cup plain Greek yogurt
For Sauce: 1 clove garlic, grated or finely minced
For Sauce: Juice of 1/2 to 1 lemon (to taste)
For Sauce: 2 tsp chopped fresh dill (or 1/2 tsp dried)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat the pork tenderloins dry. Rub them with about 1 tbsp olive oil, cumin, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper.
Place the seasoned tenderloins on one side of a large baking sheet (or use a separate roasting pan).
Roast the pork for 20-25 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C) for medium-rare to medium.

While pork starts roasting, prepare the vegetables: Gently toss the cabbage steaks and carrots with the remaining 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Arrange them in a single layer on another large baking sheet (or add to the pork sheet if space allows, ensuring they aren't overcrowded).
Roast the vegetables for about 25-30 minutes, flipping the cabbage steaks carefully halfway through, until tender and edges are slightly caramelized. (They may need slightly longer than the pork).

While pork and vegetables roast, cook the lentils: Combine rinsed lentils and water/broth in a saucepan. Add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until tender but not mushy. Drain any excess liquid.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, mix together the Greek yogurt, grated garlic, lemon juice, fresh dill, and a pinch of salt. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Once the pork is cooked, remove it from the oven and let it rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.
Slice the pork tenderloin.
Serve the sliced pork with the roasted cabbage steaks, carrots, cooked lentils, and a dollop of the Greek yogurt sauce.

name: Cilantro-Lime Chicken, Roasted Broccoli, Peppers, Chickpea Pasta
ingredients: 3 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts (or thighs)
3 tbsp olive oil (divided: ~1.5 tbsp for chicken, ~1.5 tbsp for veggies)
For Sauce: 1/4 cup fresh cilantro leaves (packed)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat chicken dry. Season generously with salt, pepper, and about 1.5 tbsp olive oil. Place on a large baking sheet.
Roast the chicken for 20-25 minutes, or until cooked through (internal temperature reaches 165°F/74°C).
While chicken cooks, toss broccoli florets and sliced bell peppers with the remaining 1.5 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread on a separate baking sheet.
Roast the vegetables for about 20 minutes (can go in the oven at the same time as the chicken or slightly after), until tender-crisp.
Cook chickpea pasta according to package directions. Drain well.
Prepare the sauce: Combine 1/4 cup olive oil, lime juice, 1 garlic clove, cilantro leaves, and 1/4 tsp salt in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth.
Once chicken is cooked, let it rest for a few minutes, then slice or dice.
Serve the cilantro-lime chicken with the roasted broccoli, peppers, and cooked chickpea pasta. Drizzle the blended sauce over the chicken and pasta.

name: Shrimp & Zoodles, Roasted Carrots & Brussels Sprouts, Brown Rice
ingredients: 1.5 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
6 medium carrots, peeled and cut into rounds or sticks
1 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
3 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for veggies, 1 tbsp for shrimp)
For Sauce: 1/4 cup tamari or soy sauce
For Sauce: 1 tbsp honey or maple syrup
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss carrots and Brussels sprouts with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly caramelized.
While vegetables roast, cook brown rice according to package directions (combine rice and water/broth, bring to boil, cover, simmer 40-45 min or until tender).
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together tamari, lime juice, honey, and minced garlic.
Pat the shrimp dry with paper towels. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the shrimp in a single layer (cook in batches if needed) and cook for 1-2 minutes per side, until pink and opaque. Do not overcook.
Remove shrimp from skillet and set aside.
Add the spiralized zucchini (zoodles) to the same skillet. Sauté over medium heat for 2-3 minutes, until just tender-crisp. Do not overcook or they will become watery.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet with the zoodles.
Pour the prepared sauce over the shrimp and zoodles. Toss gently to coat.
Serve the shrimp and zoodles mixture over the cooked brown rice, with the roasted carrots and Brussels sprouts on the side.

name: Herb Chicken Drumsticks, Roasted Squash, Broccoli, White Beans
ingredients: 1 medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
2 cans (15oz each) white beans (like cannellini or great northern), rinsed and drained
3 tbsp olive oil (divided, plus more for beans)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pat the chicken drumsticks dry. In a large bowl, toss drumsticks with about 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp dried rosemary, 1 tsp dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Arrange drumsticks on one side of a large baking sheet.
Roast for 35-45 minutes, or until cooked through (internal temp 165°F/74°C) and skin is crispy, turning occasionally.
While drumsticks cook, toss the cubed butternut squash and broccoli florets with the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spread the vegetables on a separate baking sheet (or add to the chicken sheet if space allows, adding them when the chicken has about 20-25 minutes left).
Roast vegetables for 20-25 minutes, until tender.

Shortly before serving, prepare the beans: Heat a small amount of olive oil (1-2 tsp) in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the minced garlic (1-2 cloves) and a pinch of dried rosemary (optional, about 1/4 tsp). Cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds).
Add the rinsed and drained white beans to the saucepan. Cook, stirring gently, until heated through. Season with salt and pepper if needed.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Serve the herb chicken drumsticks with the roasted squash, broccoli, and warmed white beans. Drizzle the lemon-garlic sauce over the chicken just before serving.

name: Balsamic Pork Chops, Roasted Broccoli & Carrots, Brown Rice
ingredients: 6 medium carrots, peeled and cut into rounds or sticks
3 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for veggies, 1 tbsp for chops)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
For Sauce: 1 tsp honey or maple syrup (optional, for balance)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss broccoli florets and carrots with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender-crisp and slightly caramelized.
While vegetables roast, cook brown rice according to package directions.
Pat the pork chops dry and season generously with salt and pepper on both sides.
Heat the remaining 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat.
Sear the pork chops for 4-5 minutes per side, until golden brown.
While chops sear (or just after), prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, and optional honey/maple syrup.
Reduce heat under the skillet to medium-low. Pour the balsamic sauce into the skillet around the pork chops.

Simmer for 2-3 minutes, spooning the sauce over the chops, until the sauce slightly thickens and becomes syrupy. Ensure chops are cooked through (internal temp 145°F/63°C). (Alternatively, after searing, you can transfer the skillet to the preheated oven for 5-10 minutes to finish cooking).
Let pork chops rest for a few minutes.
Serve the balsamic pork chops with the roasted broccoli, carrots, and cooked brown rice. Spoon any remaining pan sauce over the chops.

name: Lemon Garlic Tilapia, Roasted Zucchini, Peppers & Cabbage, Chickpea Pasta
ingredients: 3 medium zucchini, sliced into rounds or half-moons
3 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for veggies, 1 tbsp for fish)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Juice of 1-2 lemons (divided: some for fish topping, rest for sauce)
For Sauce: Juice of 1-2 lemons (adjust to taste)
For Sauce: 1/4 tsp salt (or to taste)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss the sliced zucchini, bell peppers, and cabbage with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until vegetables are tender and slightly browned.
While vegetables roast, cook chickpea pasta according to package directions. Drain well, and toss with a drizzle of olive oil (optional) to prevent sticking.
Pat the tilapia filets dry. Place them on a separate baking sheet lined with parchment paper (or make space on the vegetable sheet if adding later).
In a small bowl, mix 1 tbsp olive oil, the juice of about half a lemon, the minced garlic (2 cloves), salt, and pepper. Drizzle or brush this mixture evenly over the tilapia filets.
Bake the fish for 10-15 minutes (can add to oven when veggies have ~12 min left), or until the fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork.
Prepare the final sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tbsp olive oil, the juice of the remaining 1 to 1.5 lemons (adjust to your preference for tartness), and 1/4 tsp salt.
Serve the lemon garlic tilapia alongside the roasted vegetables and cooked chickpea pasta. Drizzle the final lemon-oil sauce over the fish and vegetables just before serving.

name: Greek Chicken Meatballs, Roasted Carrots & Squash, Lentils
ingredients: For Meatballs: 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
(Optional: 1/4 cup breadcrumbs or 1 egg for binding)
6 medium carrots, peeled and cut into chunks or sticks
1 medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
1.5 cups brown or green lentils, rinsed
Salt and pepper (for veggies and lentils)
For Tzatziki Sauce: 3/4 cup plain Greek yogurt
For Tzatziki Sauce: 1/2 cucumber, grated and squeezed dry
For Tzatziki Sauce: 1 clove garlic, minced or grated
For Tzatziki Sauce: Juice of 1/2 lemon
For Tzatziki Sauce: 2 tsp chopped fresh dill (or 1/2 tsp dried)
For Tzatziki Sauce: Pinch of salt
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Prepare the meatballs: In a large bowl, gently mix the ground chicken, chopped parsley, 2 minced garlic cloves, oregano, salt, and pepper (and breadcrumbs/egg if using). Do not overmix.
Form the mixture into approximately 20-24 meatballs (about 1.5 inches). Place them on the prepared baking sheet.
Bake meatballs for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through (internal temp 165°F/74°C).
While meatballs bake, prepare vegetables: On another large baking sheet, toss the carrots and butternut squash cubes with 3 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast the vegetables for 20-25 minutes (can start them slightly before or at the same time as meatballs), until tender.

Cook the lentils: Combine rinsed lentils and water/broth in a saucepan. Add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until tender. Drain any excess liquid.

Prepare the Tzatziki sauce: Grate the cucumber and squeeze out as much excess water as possible using your hands or a clean towel. In a small bowl, combine the Greek yogurt, grated cucumber, 1 minced/grated garlic clove, lemon juice, fresh dill, and a pinch of salt. Stir well. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
Serve the Greek chicken meatballs with the roasted carrots, squash, cooked lentils, and a generous dollop of Tzatziki sauce.

name: Tamari-Honey Salmon, Roasted Broccoli & Peppers, Quinoa
ingredients: 3 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for veggies, optional 1 tbsp for searing salmon)
For Sauce: 1/4 cup tamari or soy sauce
For Sauce: 1 tbsp honey or maple syrup
(Optional Garnish: Sesame seeds, sliced green onions)
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On a large baking sheet, toss the broccoli florets and sliced bell peppers with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast for 18-20 minutes, until tender-crisp.

While vegetables roast, cook the quinoa: Combine rinsed quinoa and water/broth in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until liquid is absorbed.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together tamari, honey/maple syrup, and minced garlic.
Pat the salmon filets dry. Season lightly with pepper (salt might not be needed due to tamari).

Option 1 (Bake only): Place salmon filets on a baking sheet (can add to veggie sheet if space allows, after veggies have roasted ~5 min). Brush the tamari-honey sauce over the salmon. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until cooked through.

Option 2 (Sear then Bake - recommended for crispier skin): Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Place salmon skin-side down (if applicable) and sear for 3-4 minutes until skin is crisp. Flip salmon. Brush the sauce over the top. Transfer skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 8-10 minutes, or until cooked through.
Fluff the cooked quinoa.
Serve the tamari-honey salmon with the roasted broccoli, peppers, and quinoa. Drizzle any extra sauce if desired. Garnish with sesame seeds or green onions if using.

name: Turkey Taco Bowls, Roasted Carrots, Cabbage Slaw, Brown Rice
ingredients: 6 medium carrots, peeled and cut into rounds or sticks
1/2 medium head green or red cabbage, finely shredded
3 tbsp olive oil (divided: 2 tbsp for carrots, 1 tbsp for turkey)
For Taco Spice Mix: 2 tsp cumin
For Taco Spice Mix: 2 tsp smoked paprika
For Taco Spice Mix: 1 tsp garlic powder
For Taco Spice Mix: 1 tsp dried oregano
For Taco Spice Mix: 1/2 tsp salt (or to taste)
(Optional: 1/4 tsp chili powder or cayenne for heat)
For Slaw Dressing: Juice of 2 limes
For Slaw Dressing: 2 tbsp olive oil
For Avocado Crema: 1/2 cup plain Greek yogurt or sour cream
For Avocado Crema: Juice of 1 lime
For Avocado Crema: 1 small clove garlic
For Avocado Crema: Pinch of salt
(Optional Toppings: Salsa, shredded lettuce, cheese, jalapeños)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
On a baking sheet, toss the carrots with 2 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly browned.
While carrots roast, cook brown rice according to package directions.

Prepare the Cabbage Slaw: In a medium bowl, combine the shredded cabbage. In a small bowl, whisk together the slaw dressing ingredients (lime juice, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/4 tsp salt). Pour dressing over cabbage and toss well. Add cilantro if using. Set aside (it will soften slightly).
Prepare the Taco Spice Mix: Combine cumin, smoked paprika, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and optional chili powder in a small bowl.
Cook the turkey: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground turkey and cook, breaking it apart, until browned. Drain excess fat.
Stir the prepared Taco Spice Mix into the cooked turkey. Cook for 1 minute more. (Optional: add 1/4 cup water or broth and simmer for a few minutes).
Prepare the Avocado Crema: Combine avocado, Greek yogurt/sour cream, lime juice, garlic clove, and a pinch of salt in a blender or food processor. Blend until smooth and creamy.
Assemble the bowls: Divide the cooked brown rice among bowls. Top with taco-seasoned ground turkey, roasted carrots, and cabbage slaw. Drizzle with avocado crema. Add any other desired toppings.

name: Sheet Pan Chicken & Veggies, Chickpea Pasta
ingredients: 3 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 medium butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and cubed
3 medium zucchini, cut into thick half-moons or chunks
2 bell peppers (any color), cut into chunks
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
Optional Seasonings: Italian seasoning, garlic powder, onion powder
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
On one or two large baking sheets (do not overcrowd), combine the cubed chicken, butternut squash, zucchini, and bell peppers.
Drizzle with 3-4 tbsp olive oil. Season generously with salt, pepper, and optional Italian seasoning/garlic powder/onion powder.
Toss everything together directly on the baking sheet(s) until evenly coated.
Spread into a single layer.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, tossing halfway through, until chicken is cooked through (165°F/74°C) and vegetables are tender.
While the chicken and vegetables bake, cook the chickpea pasta according to package directions. Drain well.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, minced garlic, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Combine the cooked chickpea pasta with the roasted chicken and vegetables in a large bowl (or serve pasta separately and top with chicken/veggies).
Drizzle the prepared sauce over the mixture and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately.

name: Garlic Pork Tenderloin, Roasted Broccoli & Carrots, White Beans
ingredients: 6 medium carrots, peeled and cut into rounds or sticks
2 cans (15oz each) white beans (cannellini or great northern), rinsed and drained
2-3 cloves garlic, minced (divided: some for pork, some for beans)
1 tsp dried rosemary (divided: some for pork, some for beans)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

Pat the pork tenderloins dry. In a small bowl, mix about 1 tbsp olive oil with half the minced garlic (1-1.5 cloves), 1/2 tsp rosemary, 1 tsp thyme, salt, and pepper. Rub this mixture all over the pork tenderloins.
Place seasoned pork on a baking sheet or in a roasting pan.
Roast for 20-25 minutes, until internal temperature reaches 145°F (63°C).
While pork roasts, prepare vegetables: On a separate large baking sheet, toss broccoli florets and carrots with 2 tbsp olive oil, salt, and pepper. Spread into a single layer.
Roast vegetables for 20-25 minutes (can go in oven at same time as pork), until tender-crisp.
Prepare the beans: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the remaining minced garlic (1-1.5 cloves) and the remaining 1/2 tsp rosemary. Cook until fragrant (30 seconds).
Add the rinsed and drained white beans. Cook, stirring gently, until heated through. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Prepare the sauce: In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tbsp olive oil, lemon juice, 1 minced garlic clove, and 1/4 tsp salt.
Once pork is cooked, let it rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.
Slice the pork tenderloin.
Serve the sliced garlic pork with the roasted broccoli, carrots, and warm rosemary-garlic white beans. Drizzle the lemon-garlic sauce over the pork just before serving.
